com.scorch.core.modules.permissions

Class PermissionPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scorch.core.modules.permissions.PermissionPlayer

  • public class PermissionPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    PermissionPlayer is a data class that contains all the data needed for the PermissionModule to load extra permissions a player might have besides their groups permissions.
    See Also:
    PermissionModule, PermissionGroup

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment attachment 
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> groups 
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> permissions 
      private java.util.UUID uniqueId

      PermissionPlayer is a data class that contains all the data needed for the PermissionModule to load extra permissions a player might have besides their groups permissions

      PermissionPlayer is a data class that contains all the data needed for the PermissionModule to load extra permissions a player might have besides their groups permissions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addGroupPermissions(PermissionGroup group, org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment attachment)
      This method adds all the permissions of the group to the PermissionAttachment This method is required since adding all the inherited groups for each group cannot be done without recursion.
      void addPermission(java.lang.String node)
      Adds the permission node to the player's permissions
      org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment createAttachment(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Creates the permission attachment for the player, this used by Spigot to make sure the Permissible.hasPermission(String) api works This also adds the player's extra permissions and group permissions to the PermissionAttachment object
      private org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment getAttachment()
      Gets the player's permission attachment This is what handles the permissions on Spigot's side
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGroupNames()
      Returns a list of the names of the player's groups
      java.util.List<PermissionGroup> getGroups()
      Gets the player's groups.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPermissions()
      Gets the player's permissions
      PermissionGroup getPrimaryGroup() 
      java.util.UUID getUniqueId()
      Gets the player's UUID.
      boolean hasGroup(PermissionGroup group)
      Returns true if the player is a member of the group
      boolean hasGroup(java.lang.String group)
      Returns true if the player is in the group
      private void setAttachment(org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment attachment)
      Sets the player's permission attachment This is what handles the permissions on Spigot's side.
      void updatePermissions()
      Updates the a permissions for the player, removes the PermissionAttachment and adds it again using the updated permissions

      • PermissionPlayer

        public PermissionPlayer(java.util.UUID uniqueId,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> groups,
                        java.lang.String... permissions)
        PermissionPlayer is a data class that contains all the data needed for the PermissionModule to load extra permissions a player might have besides their groups permissions
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - the uuid of the player
        groups - the groups of the player
        permissions - the permissions to add
        See Also:
        PermissionModule, PermissionGroup

    • Method Detail

      • createAttachment

        public org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment createAttachment(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Creates the permission attachment for the player, this used by Spigot to make sure the Permissible.hasPermission(String) api works This also adds the player's extra permissions and group permissions to the PermissionAttachment object
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        Returns:
        the PermissionAttachment for the player
        See Also:
        PermissionAttachment

      • addGroupPermissions

        private void addGroupPermissions(PermissionGroup group,
                                 org.bukkit.permissions.PermissionAttachment attachment)
        This method adds all the permissions of the group to the PermissionAttachment This method is required since adding all the inherited groups for each group cannot be done without recursion.
        Parameters:
        group - the group
        attachment - the attachment to add the permissions to

      • addPermission

        public void addPermission(java.lang.String node)
        Adds the permission node to the player's permissions
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add

      • updatePermissions

        public void updatePermissions()
        Updates the a permissions for the player, removes the PermissionAttachment and adds it again using the updated permissions
